Title: Bartok Cto Orch Philadelphia Ozawa Nov 1972 Live
Description: This is the second half of the concert that includes Gabrieli's Canzon for Two Voices and Mozart's Haffner Serenade with concertmaster Norman Carol on solo violin.  Seiji Ozawa conducts Bartok's Concerto for Orchestra during one of his several guest conducting gigs in the 1960s and 1970s.

Title: Brahms Pf Cto 1 Ogdon Philadelphia Ozawa Nov 1972 Live
Description: Seiji Ozawa, 37 years old here, guest conducts the Philadelphia Orchestra in Brahms Piano Concerto No. 1 with soloist John Ogdon, whose biography (Piano Man) is worth investigating.  This concert also included the Haydn Symphony No. 60 and Ligeti's Melodien, separately posted in this channel.  Ogdon is interviewed at the beginning of this upload.  Ozawa's first-movement tempi are expansive, favoring a plaintive and contemplative mood over the furious and agitated one I am more accustomed to hearing in this work.  Ogdon and Ozawa are in total agreement about this interpretation, one of whose virtues is to allow appreciation of Ogdon's gorgeous fingerwork (albeit with a few mistakes).  But unlike Helene Grimaud's recent outing with Philadelphia under similarly soft-edged accompaniment, Ogdon's powerful touch projects the necessary intensity that would permit the second movement's poignance to contrast against the first movement's anguish --- if only Ogdon had sought to capture the second movement's poignance.  He didn't.  I'm not sure what he's going for in the second movement.  The third movement is very well played, making the most of Brahms' flashy showpiece.  The orchestra sounds wonderful throughout.

Title: Gabrieli Canzon Mozart Serenade 7 Carol Philadelphia Ozawa Nov 1972 Live
Description: Seiji Ozawa guest conducts first Gabrieli’s Canzon Duodecimi Toni, from his Sacrae Symphoniae, written in 1597. Two brass choirs of the Philadelphia Orchestra produce antiphonal splendor. This work (among many other Gabrieli pieces) had previously been commercially recorded with slightly different personnel in 1968 and issued by Columbia as The Antiphonal Music of Gabrieli, played by the first chair horn, trumpet and trombone players of Philadelphia, Cleveland, and Chicago. Here it’s just Philadelphia. Next, Ozawa conducts concertmaster Norman Carol in Mozart’s Serenade No. 7 in D major, K. 250, known as the "Haffner" Serenade after the Mozart friend who commissioned it (and Symphony No. 35). It is in 8 movements, with prominent solo violin parts in movements 2-4. Indeed, the audience breaks into lengthy applause at the conclusion of the fourth movement in response to Maestro Carol’s virtuosity.

メシアン：トゥランガリーラ交響曲
小澤征爾指揮　NHK交響楽団
ピアノ）イヴォンヌ・ロリオ　オンド・マルトノ）本荘玲子
1962年7月24日　東京文化会館大ホール　録音
※歴史的な本邦初演（7月4日）に立ち会い、感激した作曲者メシアン本人の希望により実現した全曲録音。短い期間ながら小澤征爾とN響が蜜月だった時代の貴重な記録です。日本に於ける先駆者であった本荘玲子のオンド・マルトノ演奏も貴重なものです。ピアノを弾くイヴォンヌ・ロリオはメシアン夫人。当時小澤さんはまだ26歳、恐るべき才能の発芽とも言うべき名演でした。

Title: MITSUKO UCHIDA ~ Beethoven Piano Concerto # 5 / Seiji Ozawa / Saito Kinen Orchestra
Description:
Dame Mitsuko Uchida joined forces with Seiji Ozawa and the Saito Kinen Orchestra in 2006 in this performance of Beethoven's Emperor Concerto in E flat major. Ozawa formed this ensemble in 1992 in an effort to merge Japanese orchestras and performers with international artists.
As inspiring as Uchida's Mozart performances have always been, some might argue that her Beethoven interpretations are every bit as good; if not better!
Who are the greatest Living Pianists? Read: https://www.rawassertions.com/the-13-greatest-living-classical-pianists-a-bakers-dozen/
SELECTED COMPARISONS:
PERAHIA/ ECO
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RbE9cT7aDto

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LjgQpMu8LY8

Title: Stravinsky : Le Sacre du printemps        S.Ozawa / VPO  1984 live.

Seiji Ozawa / Vienna Philharmonic Orchestra
20/5/1984 Wiener Festwochen, Musikverein  live recording
ストラヴィンスキー：春の祭典
小澤征爾指揮　ウィーン・フィルハーモニー管弦楽団
1984年5月20日　ウィーン楽友協会ホール　ライブ録音
※ウィーン芸術週間の開幕公演で演奏された「春の祭典」。この演奏の成功がウィーンにおける小澤征爾の評価を絶大なものにしたそうです。

小澤征爾指揮　ボストン交響楽団
1981年10月31日　大阪フェスティバルホール　ライブ録音
※カセット音源からの起こしのため音質に難あり。演奏は終結に向かって高まるエネルギーとリズムが素晴らしい名演奏です。

Title: Tchaikovsky : Symphony No.6      S.Ozawa  movie live at La Scala 1989

2nd   19:40

4th    36:43
Seiji Ozawa / Filarmonica della Scala
30/1/1989 Milano, Theatro alla Scala movie live 
チャイコフスキー：交響曲第6番「悲愴」
小澤征爾指揮　スカラ座フィルハーモニー管弦楽団
1989年1月30日　ミラノ・スカラ座　ライブ映像（音声モノラル）
※小澤征爾入魂の「悲愴」。音声がモノラルなのは残念ですが、その演奏の熱さとドラマは彼の他の「悲愴」音源を凌駕しているように聴こえます。それを可能にしたスカラ座フィルの表現力の高さが素晴らしい。

※「世界のオザワ」という冠が当たり前になった絶頂期の記録。またこの頃のベルリン・フィルの底力を引き出した稀有な名演でした。海外の放送音源で、音質はイマイチです。

※当時ラヴィニア音楽祭の音楽監督だった32歳の小澤征爾がオーマンディの誘いを受けてサラトガ音楽祭に客演、「ペトルーシュカ」を振った貴重な記録です。
